website_summaries.verdict: Utilizes Under Armour ColdGear technology in an updated long-sleeve style. Large color variety compared to other Under Armour compression shirts for men.
pros: Scores big points for chafe-free flat seams beneath underarms and across shoulders
Dual layer with brushed interior keeps you warm
Quite a few neutral color choices
cons: Neckline can be a bit constrictive for some
Lighter colors, like yellow and white, are somewhat sheer

customer_reviews.title: UA logo peels off after very few washings
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit and feel of this product. Of course I am already out of the Amazon return window. I have literally washed it twice in cold water and hung to dry, and already the shiny silver UA logo on the mock neck is peeling off. Once removed it leaves a shadow of adhesive that is very visible and just looks tacky. I expected more from Under Armor. My Nike Pro Combats have gone through the wash dozens of times and hold up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: jberk

customer_reviews.title: Product runs Extremely Small
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great. In my opinion you cannot beat Under Armour. However, they use various manufacturers around the world. That means things get screwed up from time to time because the quality control is not standard throughout. I ware a Large. I know this because I have other Under Armour Men's ColdGear Armour Compression Mock shirts that are Large and they fit great...so that's what I ordered. The article arrived and it said Large in the label. It was small enough to fit a small 12 year old boy. So I sent it back and ordered an XXLarge. It fits just right. So, beware. These things run extremely small...at least the ones I received do.
customer_reviews.author: G-Man

customer_reviews.title: Yeah
customer_reviews.text: I thought this shirt was kinda expensive for a base layer top. I like the mock-neck tho, because my balaclava extends over the collar, which it does not do on my other base layers, so I decided to splurge. I am glad I did, this thing is WARM! I like the fleeced inside a lot. It's very soft and comfy. I bought mine very large because i wanted it to fit loosely.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Sleeves are tight!
customer_reviews.text: Based on other reviews I ordered an XXL even though I typically wear an XL in Under Armour. The sleeves were the concern in other reviews and was well warranted. With my XXL I have plenty of room in the torso, I'm 6'4 and 240lbs, but the sleeves are snug. Definitely order a size up from what you normally wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but quality is lower then old UnderArmour
customer_reviews.text: I've had the older version of this Compression Long Sleeve Shirt for over 12 years. The older one has a longer neck and the UA logo is embroidered. I have literally washed that one in excess of 200 times over the years. I've washed this new one 3 times and the logo is already coming off, which makes it look bad. Disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: twixster

customer_reviews.title: great Under Armour ColdGear Compression Mock for Men
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product IS AMAZING!!!! I am a Small but I ordered an Medium because I don't like to feel super "compressed". If you are like me, I suggest you order 1 size larger :) This compression mock is beautiful... I use it for running, crossfit and snowboarding. I LOVE IT!!! and you will love it too... I guarantee that :) Info about this amazing product: * 87% Polyester, 13% Elastane * Imported * Dual-layer fabric with an ultra-warm, brushed interior & a slick, fast-drying exterior * 4-way stretch fabrication allows greater mobility in any direction * Moisture Transport System wicks sweat & dries fast * Smooth, chafe-free flatlock seam construction
customer_reviews.author: TDS

customer_reviews.title: Under Armour logo flaked off before the first wash
customer_reviews.text: The Under Armour logo started flaming off before I even had a chance to wash it. The stitching in one spot was also frayed. Not sure if it’s counterfeit or what but the quality was terrible in comparison to all my other under armour gear.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Decreased quality since 2016.
customer_reviews.text: It is really a second-skin, compression. It keeps me warm enough with a coldgear hoodie when the temperature is below 0 (-7 Celsius). However the quality is decreased since 2016. I have the same product from back then and they used a different technology with a better ventilation system. You can see on the pics that the material is also different; I'd prefer the old one (orange)
customer_reviews.author: David Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Nice shirt- VERY tight sleeves -take note of sizing reviews!!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shirt, nice design, but Please Take notice of other sizing reviews. Ordered one size up and it was extremely constricting - to the point of veins bulging from my hands as the sleeves are so tight. Tried on an XL at a local store with the same result . I am 5'8" 155# so not a body builder or what anyone would describe as muscular. Bought as a base layer for biking in the cold weather. The Nike Hyperwarm was a better fit at one size up.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart O.

customer_reviews.title: Cold Gear , Not So Much
customer_reviews.text: I've bought some U-A 3.0 cold gear in the past, and this did not have the thickness and or the waffling construction and my biggest complaint was the Mock was weak, limp so to speak, as it rolled and folded over every single time, to the point that it had to be returned. One huge positive was the outer sheen , feel of the product which made it a fine base layer at best
customer_reviews.author: Ronbro C.

customer_reviews.title: Warmest Compression Layer Yet!
customer_reviews.text: Like all Under Armour clothing I've purchased, the ColdGear Compression fits and feels like it was made for me. Since we've had such a mild winter, I've only needed to wear this twice, and both times it has lived up to my expectations and has kept me warm. This is a compression shirt. It is supposed to be skin tight and conforming with a slight squeeze. This shirt does exactly that.
customer_reviews.author: david scovel

customer_reviews.title: Warm and comfy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome long sleeve for winter tennis. Tight to the skin--almost feels like you're not wearing anything. Moisture-wicking is great and keeps you dry. A bit tough to put on but it's true to fit (I think). Only complaint on the fit is the length seems a little long, but maybe it's that way to allow you to reach upwards and not have the shirt rolling above your waist.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Fits comfortably as an innermost layer AND performs pretty nicely as ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased a a wicking layer to go under merrino wool thermals. Fits comfortably as an innermost layer AND performs pretty nicely as a thermal layer by itself. I like the color quite a lot and while I am usually not a mock-neck wearer, this is not uncomfortable for me and I'm actually pleasantly used to the feel. Happy with this purchase and would probably get another in the future. Note - I am a 6'2 male, 170 lbs and the large fits me pretty much perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: CoyoteTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Essential for cold people like me
customer_reviews.text: I’m a cold person and usually inactive in the winter. These shirts were part of my cold weather workout initiative for the 19-20 winter. They’re essential! I’ve been active so much more than other years.
customer_reviews.author: Hrmn315

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and warm.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first compression fit top so I ordered a large and an extra large. The large was too small but the extra large was perfect, skin tight but without the squeeze. I wear Under Armour large shirts but the large compression fit was too tight. I'm worried the grey seams will show through my dress shirts; review will be updated if so. 5' 10", 220lbs, Size XL
customer_reviews.author: Hugo

customer_reviews.title: Impossible
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this shirt. It sizes way too small. It was made overseas in Jordan. I purchased a large, it’s a compression top, size large. I’m 5’11 175 lbs. basically average size. I could barely get it on, I’m no muscle bound person but I couldn’t get my arms in the sleeves, let alone put it over my trunk. I’ve worn compression tops before. The only thing I can think of is it was a boys large and mislabeled. There not much difference between a L and XL so I doubt that would fit either.
customer_reviews.author: jt

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered the Under Armour for my husband. He didn't care for it. He works outside, in freezing temps all day, and said it didn't keep him as warm as regular cotton long johns. Also, the hairs on his arms, and legs get caught in the fabric, and make him itch. However, I took them over, and although they are quite long on me, I love them. Very comfortable, and warm enough for my short bursts of outdoor activities on the farm.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D. Mathison

customer_reviews.title: Good product but a little hard to fit for irregular sizes
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well and is warm. It definitely is compression gear. The size is a bit weird but I'm also a strange size. While the waist area fits well, the length is a bit long and the chest is very tight. I think the best size up would be perfect but then it would be too long in the arms and torso. I'm 5'3" and I got a small, but I have a 38" chest.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, and works well
customer_reviews.text: I don't care at all about logos. Instead, I buy what works. And these work. Yes, you're paying more (because it has a UA logo on it), but the construction and effectiveness are top notch. In a 5K run this afternoon in 39 degree weather, this kept me warm, but without overheating. I am 5' 10", 160' and the medium fits very well.
customer_reviews.author: DeeJay

customer_reviews.title: Very tight fit, great quality and durability
customer_reviews.text: I have had the same long sleeve shirt in size large for about 5 years now and it fits quite loose. I'm 6'2 and about 175 slim-athletic build. This time I went with the Medium hoping for a more compression style fit. I couldn't even get it on my arms and barely got it over my shoulders and it's a workout to get it over my chest. They fit VERY tight. I'm returning for a size Large.
customer_reviews.author: L. Flinders

customer_reviews.title: neck is too tight for me
customer_reviews.text: I wore it a few times over winter and after the first, I ended up cutting the compression neck so I could move my neck from side to side.. it is a really small hole. Other than that it served its purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Derrek

customer_reviews.title: Was surprised how fast the Logo on the neck fell off
customer_reviews.text: Great product but for the price as the Logo fell off after a couple of washes I feel I could have paid half for a no brand. Surprised as I have so many great UA products and never seen this before.
customer_reviews.author: Michael MacMillan

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shirts for cold weather workouts. So much so that he wanted 3 more in different colors. When he finally finds something he loves, he tends to stick with it. He wears them even when not working out during winter.
customer_reviews.author: justinetn

customer_reviews.title: Believe the reviews: sleeves are very tight!
customer_reviews.text: I should have read more of the reviews before ordering, first at my expected size (L), and then at a size up (XL). The reviews stating that the sleeves are extremely tight are dead-on. I don't want THAT much compression. I am afraid to get a comfortable pressure in sleeves I would have to go XXL where the rest of the shirt would be relatively loose by comparison. FWIW I have relatively unmuscular arms, which makes me concur with other reviews that anybody with muscular arms AT ALL should probably look elsewhere unless you're looking for a very restricting fit.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel from Boston

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: My son wears this product at work when he is outside in the winter chill. He is very satisfied with the fit. comfort and warmth. In fact he'd like to buy long johns (the pant part) made of this fabric. It's stood up through many washes and is still in good shape. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: MoneyMom

customer_reviews.title: Expected good quality. Fits like a glove.
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my son who plays soccer for the NYRB U13. Its color blends very well with his jersey. He was perfectly fine with it under his jersey when he was playing outdoors at 32F. This is his 6th or 7th UA. They do not wear out easily. He just outgrows them then we donate them to a charity.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer007

customer_reviews.title: ARMORED UP, ON A BUDGET!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so its second skin tight, HATE THAT!! I wear a med size normally I believe the term is showrooming but that's what I did lrg was still S-skin tight. Went with X-LRG PERFECT FIT NOT OVERLY TIGHT NOR LOOSE, LOVE IT!!! AND THE PRICE WAS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING
customer_reviews.author: Kitcheninja

customer_reviews.title: Good shirt
customer_reviews.text: My son's father works outside all winter and likes to wear under armour instead of long johns. This shirt did not disappoint. It's comfortable and keeps him warm. It's good quality and arrived as expected. Happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nicsy

customer_reviews.title: Winter Hunting or Sports
customer_reviews.text: Much tighter than purchased in years earlier. This is so tight that my husband can not use it. My daughter will probably wear it, but that is not why I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Works good but tight
customer_reviews.text: It really nice keeps me warmer but I wish that the sleeves had a little more room. They are super tight like uncomfortably tight, but they are the right length maybe even an inch to long
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good as a base layer for snowboarding
customer_reviews.text: Works really work as a base layer for snow sports. Fits snag and keeps my body warm. I bought a size small and I'm about 5'9, while the shoulder width is perfect, the length is slightly long.
customer_reviews.author: C. Zheng

customer_reviews.title: Very.... snug
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, warm, and flexible material. Quality appears ok after 2 machine washes. My only complaint is how tight fitting it is... I ordered a medium based on the recommendations provided. Its very tight in the neck and shoulders. I'm 6'0", 175 lb (swimmer's build)
customer_reviews.author: SteveMc

customer_reviews.title: Reconsider Sizing
customer_reviews.text: This particular UA is very small comparatively to the other dozen or so Under Armour Cold Gear shirts I've bought for my husband. Other than fit, quality good but can't say value is since my husband can't wear the item. If it fit it would be a great value. Packaging thrown out so didn't figure I could return item unfortunately. Disappointed in sizing!
customer_reviews.author: Caroll

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband, per his request. He wanted another one for a base layer to go skiing in. It kept him warm. Plus it goes well with his black KC Chiefs jersey.
customer_reviews.author: Jana B.

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two of them in size large. I always wear medium shirts and knew that these run a little smaller. But they are way to small. I almost thought they shipped me a woman’s version but, no. Order 2x your size
customer_reviews.author: James O'Reilly

customer_reviews.title: The best base layer
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal. I usually buy Tesla or other amazon base layers and they are cheaper and good, but the UA is expensive and totally worth the money. I’m usually XL but got this in 2XL and it fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: John Parker

customer_reviews.title: but that is easy to compensate with another light running shirt if needed
customer_reviews.text: It is a replacement for a similar one I have used for years. It works well for me while bicycling during winters when temperatures are in the 40's and occasionally below freezing during the rides. This particular one is less padded than the previous one, which looks identical, so it is not as warm, but that is easy to compensate with another light running shirt if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the underarmour to get
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My son uses for skating. He has a lot of underarmours but this one is thicker than the rest and I love the collar and the trim On the arms and shoulders. Planning to get more
customer_reviews.author: Frances Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased x2 the size I needed. Mainly as over garment until I warm up at the gym. The material is super thick. Very surprised. If you live in North or work outside. Perfect to keep warm.
customer_reviews.author: RDTEX

customer_reviews.title: Best for keeping warm in winter
customer_reviews.text: Best top for under layering for winter would highly recommend if you don’t like a high turtle neck feel this particular model has a lower cut around the neck I have both styles it is the only gear I wear for work every day under my work clothes protects my skin from cold and wind.
customer_reviews.author: ROCK

customer_reviews.title: Love it, but rather expensive
customer_reviews.text: Wore this for the first time today for my daily power walk. Loved it. Warm, supportive, nice fit for me. I want to buy four more, now. However, at close to $40 a shirt they are rather expensive.
customer_reviews.author: GARY DYE

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, seems fake
customer_reviews.text: The shirt seemed like a fake UA item. The painted-on UA logo on the neck chipped off while wearing the shirt for the first time! Did not expect this from a UA shirt. The compression is also not as effective as UA heatgear shirt. I've already worn it once, so can't return it for hygiene reasons, but will rate it 1 star for the poor quality. Fit: as expected. I'm 5'9/175 and a M fit me well as baselayer.
customer_reviews.author: Ankit

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercise
customer_reviews.text: Great to wear under uniform. Went in a training exercise, from cold night of sleeping in the field to warm morning and noon of urban terrain exercise with no problems whatsoever. The fit is good, the material is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Oleg Ulogov

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in a large and they fit perfectly. I opened this one up cut the tags off and threw it in the laundry, washed and dried it and went to put it on and it’s way way too small!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Highy necessary if you live on the northern states..
customer_reviews.text: I've bought a few of the coldgear shirts before but this time decided towards a heatgear compression shirt due to some record breaking below 0 degree days. Just like the others, it fits well (Large size) and everything seems ok as of now (all seems are well constructed). Would certainly buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It’s UA, of course it’s a great product! I work outside, no matter the weather. This is great base layer for winter weather or a chilly fall/spring weather!
customer_reviews.author: Mlhurd

customer_reviews.title: Wrist is small for medium Large is not tight for my wrist
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a medium size from the same company the wrist is the only thing that's too tight for me. I purchased a large one and it fits great for me. I prefer medium but the wrist part of the long sleeves it causes to loose blood circulation because it's very tight for my wrist. Otherwise medium is great for me if the wrist was a bit more wider.
customer_reviews.author: R.F.M.

customer_reviews.title: Great workout shirt for indoor & outside activities
customer_reviews.text: I use this under armour shirt to play softball in a fall league. Overall i like the shirt a lot, it keeps me warm. Only thing that bothers me is it tends to rise up at times and i have to frequently pull the shirt down, other than that i don't have any problems with the shirt.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Best price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product was received on time and price was lower than any other site. Great value! This was a gift for my son. He requested it, so I’m quite sure it’s exactly what he wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Peaches

customer_reviews.title: A bit snug thru the shoulders, but overall an excellent performer.
customer_reviews.text: The fit is a bit tight through the shoulders. As a compression shirt it is supposed to be tight, but it is tight to the point that it is a bit restrictive when raising my arms. It fits well in every other area, so it isn't a question of being the wrong size. But I work around that by pulling the sleeves a but toward the elbow. Overall I love the feel, the light weight, and how it handles different weather.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Maddock

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: This shirt is amazing, I will use it to do yard work, go to Eagles games and play golf in the cold. I recently used it to play golf when it was 30 degrees out and it keep me nice and warm. Perfect base layer. The material is soft and hugs your body just right. It is tight without restricting movement. Awesome product!!
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: These compression garments always make my husband feel like he is being vacuum sealed
customer_reviews.text: These compression garments always make my husband feel like he is being vacuum sealed, so I purchased a size bigger for him and it worked perfect for him. The minute you put it on you feel the difference in warmth but doesn't feel heavy like a sweater, great to wear as your base layer for any outdoor activity in the winter.
customer_reviews.author: hockeymomof3

customer_reviews.title: Logo unravels
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable and warm. Like others have mentioned the Under Armour logo on the neck unraveled on both shirts. I’m not sure why this happened on both shirts, perhaps the quality control needs to be looked at.
customer_reviews.author: K9623

customer_reviews.title: It's Christmas, I'm cold, but I'm not an elf.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a big guy. But my Small probably would fit a small 8th grade boy. I couldn't even get the small over my shoulders, and I'm 120lbs soaking wet. There's no way the size guide is even close, unless they're sizing for elves.
customer_reviews.author: Camryn Bell

customer_reviews.title: He took it hiking in Feb to Grand Canyon after a beautiful snowfall. He came home and asked if I ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this shirt. He took it hiking in Feb to Grand Canyon after a beautiful snowfall. He came home and asked if I would get him some more. They do fit snug, but that is the design for the warmth. Not recommended for people that do not like tight clothing. My husband normally wears a large so we got XL and it gave him a looser fit.
customer_reviews.author: Karen J DeWitt

customer_reviews.title: Underarmour Warm Shirt
customer_reviews.text: I had to order 2 sizes larger, as the 1st one was so small. So if you wear a 2XL Men, order a 4XL. It's a great product though. Keeping you very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Dee See

customer_reviews.title: Under Armour happy customer
customer_reviews.text: I do not dislike anything about Under Armour I work outside all year round I even buy heat gear or the cold gear and these particular pieces that I just bought I love them because I love the colors they come in
customer_reviews.author: Sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality - had to get size right. Order one size larger than your normal size.
customer_reviews.text: Usually I'm a medium but the medium was too small so I sent it back and got the large. It was easy to return the product for the right size. Thank you!! Very well made product. I haven't worn it in the cold outside but it seems like it will keep me very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Don Callme

customer_reviews.title: Product description does not match
customer_reviews.text: The product description says "fitted" however shirt recieved is "compression". Returned for another fitted shirt, recieved another compression shirt. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shirt for cool or cold weather
customer_reviews.text: Its a great shirt for keeping your body heat in if you are running in the morning, or in lower temps
customer_reviews.author: Shane Ryken

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dime!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the top and bottom piece for my Husband for work and deer lease for the cold weather.. He wants me order more!! Kept him warm enough under his FRC’s in 46 degree weather. Ordered 2XL since he’s 6’5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased this.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a second one so I bought this one. Feels great wearing it and very comfortable as well. When my other one is dirty or needs washing I have a back up!! Glad I bought a 2nd one
customer_reviews.author: A. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Well made runs super small though
customer_reviews.text: Super tight compression... definitely not 2XL for compression either. Waited forever too. Well made though.
customer_reviews.author: Fergy

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it every time if the cost was a little better.
customer_reviews.text: They fit and work better than the others I’ve compared. If only they were more price friendly.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Fit large 22 inch armpit to armpit saddle bags? NG
customer_reviews.text: Two things to reveal. For the money embroidered labelling as a-posed to peeling Cheap self adhesive labeled armourall icons. Be proud of your labeling identity. Over gentle washing those small balls will surface from wear. Well I’m up to twelve now so rotation should help with my concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Desmond

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent find an excellent price. Very comfortable and durable and lasts a long time!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Value & Material!
customer_reviews.text: My 15 years old grandson loves these compression leggings. He is on a rowing team, and they are perfect for Winter rowing.
customer_reviews.author: KASBrooks

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write product reviews, but am so impressed with this Under Armour product that it is warranted. I am a large guy and haven't needed cold weather gear in my youth, but metabolism and age have left me cold so-to-speak during outdoor, very cold winter events. This product fits well, is comfortable AND DOES WHAT IT CLAIMS!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Allen

customer_reviews.title: Tight Fit
customer_reviews.text: When they say it's skin tight they aren't kidding. I'm a pretty slender guy, 5'11" just under 160lbs. The large is still pretty tight on the arms and I've got really skinny wrists too. It's good quality though and seems like it'll be great for my upcoming snowboarding trip.
customer_reviews.author: Some guy on the Internet

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those cold days
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those cold days. It fits perfect. My 13 year old is growing and some other thermo items are shorter in length. This one is a bit longer which is what I wanted. I would buy more next year when he grows out of this one. Great quality! Fits snug, great length.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable and washes well
customer_reviews.text: Great fit , comfortable and washes well. My son needed these at the last moment for soccer games in colder weather. Breathes well in colder temp. Good buy for this usage!
customer_reviews.author: DMLeGare

customer_reviews.title: A bit too snug to wear all day.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these and a pair of Hot Chilies for a trip to Canada. I found myself wearing these only once and the Chilies the rest of the time. They seemed to be about the same warmness, which is very good, but the medium UAs were very tight fitting and I am a skinny guy (5'11 - 145). These fit more like compression pants, which may be very good for a pure athletic outing, but bothersome for a whole day out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mealey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love everything about this. Purchased for my son who works outside and it keeps him very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Becca Dawn West

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I work outdoors and this product does the job. Keeps me warm and able to move around without feeling constricted by layers of clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Joell Davis

customer_reviews.title: Must buy product!
customer_reviews.text: I work in a cooler so I need thermals, I purchased the top and bottoms and it has DEFINITELY been worth the purchase. Good flexibility, definitely keeps you warm, and has that signature under armour comfort feeling. 5/5 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: James Miller

customer_reviews.title: Warm and true to size fitting
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for wear under uniform. Fit as expected and keeps you warm without being bulky or heavy.
customer_reviews.author: tls

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Got a large for my 15 yr old son. He's 5'10 155lbs with a slender build. The fit is as expected (and desired). Its not a tight squeeze, but a light squeeze. Want him to use it next season too. So I think we got it just right to make room for a growing boy.
customer_reviews.author: ajn

customer_reviews.title: Not feeling like bball weather
customer_reviews.text: We were going to return as this shirt runs small but kept because of weather and needed "something" in this crazy NE spring snow. Not feeling like bball weather. would recommend ordering 2 sizes up. Well made UAshirt

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate this product
customer_reviews.text: I wear my under armor everyday after it starts getting cold in October. When I’m working in a warm environment, the temperature has to be over 75* before it becomes a little to warm for comfort. But basically, it maintains my body temperature at a very comfortable level.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Cole

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: What can you say! Under Armour coldgear is real good stuff. Worth every nickle. You cannot put a price tag on the value of a product that keeps you warm on a cold day without a lot of bulk.
customer_reviews.author: Banjo

customer_reviews.title: Don't count on it being warm
customer_reviews.text: I was wanting something to help keep me warm by wearing it under my jacket. However, this garment does not provide any warmth at all and is basically an overpriced long sleeve shirt. I'm very disappointed and will never buy anything like this from UA again.
customer_reviews.author: Daily Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Definitely order up in size
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who normally wears a size large but based on other reviewers I ordered extra large and it was certainly the right decision. That's said he's very happy with this
customer_reviews.author: pgbuzz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my boyfriend. He really likes it. It is a very snug fit. Keeps him warm!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Serves Its Purpose
customer_reviews.text: Definitely keeps you warm. It's more tighter than Nike's version and I prefer a little more of a looser fit but all in all it serves its purpose in keeping you warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter golf
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good winter base layer and this is a very good thermal shirt. Definitely fits well without restricting movemnet. This will help make winter golf in the Midwest doable.
customer_reviews.author: dwilson113

customer_reviews.title: Keeps you warm for sure.  But VERY tight for the size.
customer_reviews.text: I know that it's supposed to be tight. But it is ridiculously tight. On the plus side, it does help keep you warm. I used it several times when golfing in 40 degree weather and I was not cold.
customer_reviews.author: Pirktisuksles

customer_reviews.title: Keeps You Warm In the Cold.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shirt for a Mud Run where I knew the weather was going to be cold. I was fairly pleased with how well it did. I stayed warm for 90% of the race until I jumped into the cold water. That is not the shirts fault though because it certaintly is not water proof. My only complaint is it does not dry quickly. It will actually weigh you down a bit if it gets wet.

customer_reviews.text: As I have experienced many times before (and why I keep coming back), Under Armour Cold Gear is the best for warmth, "wicking", fit and comfort - winter brings single digit temps and I rely on my Cold Gear to keep me comfortable on early AM runs.
